KM Masagena Patah Kemudi di Perairan Selayar, Tim SAR Evakuasi Penumpang
06 Nov 2019, 09:48 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar - Tim SAR gabungan mengevakuasi 10 kru dan penumpang KM Masagena Satu yang mengalami kerusakan di perairan Selayar, Sulsel. Kapal ini mengalami patah kemudi.
Kepala Kantor Badan SAR Makassar, Mustari, dalam keterangannya, Rabu (6/11/2019), mengatakan KM Masagena Satu mengalami patah kemudi sekitar 7 mil laut dari Pelabuhan Pattumbukang, Selayar. Peristiwa patah kemudi itu terjadi Selasa (5/11) sekitar pukul 15.00 Wita.
Akibat kerusakan di bagian kemudi, kapal yang mengangkut wisatawan ini terbawa arus dan terombang-ambing di lautan.
"Saat Pos Basarnas Selayar menerima info kapal dengan 10 penumpang, tim Basarnas Selayar langsung mengerahkan kapal cepat untuk mencari kapal di lokasi yang dilaporkan, dengan melibatkan potensi SAR lainnya," ujar Mustari.
Setelah melakukan pencarian, Basarnas Selayar bersama tim SAR gabungan yang terdiri dari Tagana, BPBD, Polres, dan Kodim Selayar, menemukan Kapal Masagena Satu sekitar 400 meter dari lokasi terakhir yang dilaporkan.
Tim SAR Gabungan kemudian mengevakuasi kesepuluh orang penumpang kapal bersama ABK dan nahkodanya dengan menggunakan kapal cepat atau Rigid Inflatable Boat (RIB) milik Basarnas Selayar sekitar pukul 20.00 Wita malam tadi, menuju Pelabuhan Pattumbukang.
Kesepuluh penumpang dan ABK KM Masagena, yaitu Melisa (27), Fitra (28), Ijal (37), Indah (29), Bob (31), Patta Saleh (41), Erfan (33), Irwan (25), serta Nakhoda kapal bernama Saiful (35) dan ABK-nya, Bur (27).
"Setelah penumpang dievakuasi, kapal Masagena ditarik oleh kapal nelayan setempat menuju Pelabuhan Pattumbukang," pungkas Mustari.

KM Masagena Broken Steering in Selayar Waters, SAR Team for Passenger Evacuation
Nov 6, 2019, 09:48 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar - The combined SAR team evacuated 10 crew and passengers of KM Masagena Satu who were damaged in Selayar waters, South Sulawesi. This ship has a broken steering.
Head of the Makassar SAR Agency Office, Mustari, in his statement on Wednesday (11/06/2019), said KM Masagena Satu suffered a broken wheel about 7 nautical miles from the Port of Pattumbukang, Selayar. The steering wheel fracture occurred Tuesday (5/11) at around 3:00 pm.
As a result of damage in the rudder, the ship carrying tourists is swept away and oscillated in the ocean.
"When the Selasar Basarnas Post received information on ships with 10 passengers, the Selasar Basarnas team immediately deployed speed boats to search for vessels in the reported location, involving other SAR potentials," Mustari said.
After conducting a search, Selasar Basarnas together with a combined SAR team consisting of Tagana, BPBD, Polres, and Selayar Kodim, found the Masagena Satu Ship about 400 meters from the last reported location.
The Joint SAR Team then evacuated the ten passengers along with the crew and the captain by using a speed boat or Rigid Inflatable Boat (RIB) owned by Selasar Basarnas around 20:00 West Indonesia Time last night, heading to the Port of Pattumbukang.
The ten passengers and crew of KM Masagena, namely Melisa (27), Fitra (28), Ijal (37), Indah (29), Bob (31), Patta Saleh (41), Erfan (33), Irwan (25), and The ship's captain was named Saiful (35) and his crew, Bur (27).
"After the passengers were evacuated, the Masagena ship was pulled by a local fishing boat to the Port of Pattumbukang," concluded Mustari.
